livegrep

Fast, regular expression code search service
git clone https://source.static.kevinlin.info/external/livegrep.git
Log | Files | Refs | README | LICENSE

      1 package main
      2 
      3 import (
      4 	"context"
      5 	"encoding/json"
      6 	"flag"
      7 	"fmt"
      8 	"io/ioutil"
      9 	"log"
     10 	"os"
     11 	"os/exec"
     12 	"path"
     13 	"strings"
     14 	"sync"
     15 
     16 	"github.com/livegrep/livegrep/src/proto/config"
     17 	pb "github.com/livegrep/livegrep/src/proto/go_proto"
     18 	"google.golang.org/grpc"
     19 )
     20 
     21 var (
     22 	flagCodesearch    = flag.String("codesearch", "", "Path to the `codesearch` binary")
     23 	flagIndexPath     = flag.String("out", "livegrep.idx", "Path to write the index")
     24 	flagRevparse      = flag.Bool("revparse", true, "whether to `git rev-parse` the provided revision in generated links")
     25 	flagSkipMissing   = flag.Bool("skip-missing", false, "skip repositories where the specified revision is missing")
     26 	flagReloadBackend = flag.String("reload-backend", "", "Backend to send a Reload RPC to")
     27 )
     28 
     29 const Workers = 8
     30 
     31 func main() {
     32 	flag.Parse()
     33 	log.SetFlags(0)
     34 
     35 	if len(flag.Args()) != 1 {
     36 		log.Fatal("Expected exactly one argument (the index json configuration)")
     37 	}
     38 
     39 	data, err := ioutil.ReadFile(flag.Arg(0))
     40 	if err != nil {
     41 		log.Fatalf(err.Error())
     42 	}
     43 
     44 	var cfg config.IndexSpec
     45 	if err = json.Unmarshal(data, &cfg); err != nil {
     46 		log.Fatalf("reading %s: %s", flag.Arg(0), err.Error())
     47 	}
     48 
     49 	if err := checkoutRepos(&cfg.Repositories); err != nil {
     50 		log.Fatalln(err.Error())
     51 	}
     52 
     53 	tmp := *flagIndexPath + ".tmp"
     54 
     55 	args := []string{
     56 		"--debug=ui",
     57 		"--dump_index",
     58 		tmp,
     59 		"--index_only",
     60 	}
     61 	if *flagRevparse {
     62 		args = append(args, "--revparse")
     63 	}
     64 	args = append(args, flag.Arg(0))
     65 
     66 	cmd := exec.Command(findCodesearch(*flagCodesearch), args...)
     67 	cmd.Stdout = os.Stdout
     68 	cmd.Stderr = os.Stderr
     69 	if err := cmd.Run(); err != nil {
     70 		log.Fatalln(err)
     71 	}
     72 
     73 	if err := os.Rename(tmp, *flagIndexPath); err != nil {
     74 		log.Fatalln("rename:", err.Error())
     75 	}
     76 
     77 	if *flagReloadBackend != "" {
     78 		if err := reloadBackend(*flagReloadBackend); err != nil {
     79 			log.Fatalln("reload:", err.Error())
     80 		}
     81 	}
     82 }
     83 
     84 func findCodesearch(given string) string {
     85 	if given != "" {
     86 		return given
     87 	}
     88 	search := []string{
     89 		path.Join(path.Dir(os.Args[0]), "codesearch"),
     90 		"bazel-bin/src/tools/codesearch",
     91 	}
     92 	for _, try := range search {
     93 		if st, err := os.Stat(try); err == nil && (st.Mode()&os.ModeDir) == 0 {
     94 			return try
     95 		}
     96 	}
     97 	return "codesearch"
     98 }
     99 
    100 func checkoutRepos(repos *[]*config.RepoSpec) error {
    101 	repoc := make(chan *config.RepoSpec)
    102 	errc := make(chan error, Workers)
    103 	stop := make(chan struct{})
    104 	wg := sync.WaitGroup{}
    105 	wg.Add(Workers)
    106 	for i := 0; i < Workers; i++ {
    107 		go func() {
    108 			defer wg.Done()
    109 			checkoutWorker(repoc, stop, errc)
    110 		}()
    111 	}
    112 
    113 	var err error
    114 Repos:
    115 	for i := range *repos {
    116 		select {
    117 		case repoc <- (*repos)[i]:
    118 		case err = <-errc:
    119 			close(stop)
    120 			break Repos
    121 		}
    122 	}
    123 
    124 	close(repoc)
    125 	wg.Wait()
    126 	select {
    127 	case err = <-errc:
    128 	default:
    129 	}
    130 
    131 	return err
    132 }
    133 
    134 func checkoutWorker(c <-chan *config.RepoSpec,
    135 	stop <-chan struct{}, errc chan error) {
    136 	for {
    137 		select {
    138 		case r, ok := <-c:
    139 			if !ok {
    140 				return
    141 			}
    142 			err := checkoutOne(r)
    143 			if err != nil {
    144 				errc <- err
    145 			}
    146 		case <-stop:
    147 			return
    148 		}
    149 	}
    150 }
    151 
    152 const credentialHelperScript = (`#!/bin/sh
    153 if test "$1" = "get"; then
    154   pass=` + "`cat <&3`" + `
    155   if test -n "$LIVEGREP_GITHUB_USERNAME"; then
    156     echo "username=$LIVEGREP_GITHUB_USERNAME"
    157   fi
    158   if test -n "$pass"; then
    159     echo "password=$pass"
    160   fi
    161 fi
    162 `)
    163 
    164 func callGit(program string, args []string, username string, password string) error {
    165 	var err error
    166 
    167 	if username != "" || password != "" {
    168 		// If we're given credentials, pass them to git via a
    169 		// credential helper
    170 		//
    171 		// In order to avoid the key hitting the
    172 		// filesystem, we pass the actual key via a
    173 		// pipe on fd `3`, and we set the askpass
    174 		// script to a tiny sh script that just reads
    175 		// from that pipe.
    176 		f, err := ioutil.TempFile("", "livegrep-credential-helper")
    177 		if err != nil {
    178 			return err
    179 		}
    180 		f.WriteString(credentialHelperScript)
    181 		f.Close()
    182 		defer os.Remove(f.Name())
    183 
    184 		os.Chmod(f.Name(), 0700)
    185 		args = append([]string{"-c", fmt.Sprintf("credential.helper=%s", f.Name())}, args...)
    186 	}
    187 
    188 	for i := 0; i < 3; i++ {
    189 		cmd := exec.Command("git", args...)
    190 		cmd.Stdout = os.Stdout
    191 		cmd.Stderr = os.Stderr
    192 		if password != "" {
    193 			r, w, err := os.Pipe()
    194 			if err != nil {
    195 				return err
    196 			}
    197 
    198 			cmd.ExtraFiles = []*os.File{r}
    199 
    200 			go func() {
    201 				defer w.Close()
    202 				w.WriteString(password)
    203 			}()
    204 			defer r.Close()
    205 		}
    206 		if username != "" {
    207 			cmd.Env = append(os.Environ(), fmt.Sprintf("LIVEGREP_GITHUB_USERNAME=%s", username))
    208 		}
    209 		if err = cmd.Run(); err == nil {
    210 			return nil
    211 		}
    212 	}
    213 	return fmt.Errorf("%s %v: %s", program, args, err.Error())
    214 }
    215 
    216 func checkoutOne(r *config.RepoSpec) error {
    217 	log.Println("Updating", r.Name)
    218 
    219 	remote := r.Metadata.Remote
    220 	if remote == "" {
    221 		return fmt.Errorf("git remote not found in repository metadata for %s", r.Name)
    222 	}
    223 
    224 	out, err := exec.Command("git", "-C", r.Path, "rev-parse", "--is-bare-repository").Output()
    225 	if err != nil {
    226 		if _, ok := err.(*exec.ExitError); !ok {
    227 			return err
    228 		}
    229 	}
    230 	var username, password string
    231 	if r.CloneOptions != nil {
    232 		username = r.CloneOptions.Username
    233 		password = os.Getenv(r.CloneOptions.PasswordEnv)
    234 	}
    235 	if strings.Trim(string(out), " \n") != "true" {
    236 		if err := os.RemoveAll(r.Path); err != nil {
    237 			return err
    238 		}
    239 		if err := os.MkdirAll(r.Path, 0755); err != nil {
    240 			return err
    241 		}
    242 		args := []string{"clone", "--mirror"}
    243 		if r.CloneOptions != nil && r.CloneOptions.Depth != 0 {
    244 			args = append(args, fmt.Sprintf("--depth=%d", r.CloneOptions.Depth))
    245 		}
    246 		args = append(args, remote, r.Path)
    247 		return callGit("git", args, username, password)
    248 	}
    249 
    250 	if err := exec.Command("git", "-C", r.Path, "remote", "set-url", "origin", remote).Run(); err != nil {
    251 		return err
    252 	}
    253 
    254 	args := []string{"--git-dir", r.Path, "fetch", "-p"}
    255 	if r.CloneOptions != nil && r.CloneOptions.Depth != 0 {
    256 		args = append(args, fmt.Sprintf("--depth=%d", r.CloneOptions.Depth))
    257 	}
    258 	return callGit("git", args, username, password)
    259 }
    260 
    261 func reloadBackend(addr string) error {
    262 	client, err := grpc.Dial(addr, grpc.WithInsecure())
    263 	if err != nil {
    264 		return err
    265 	}
    266 
    267 	codesearch := pb.NewCodeSearchClient(client)
    268 
    269 	if _, err = codesearch.Reload(context.Background(), &pb.Empty{}, grpc.FailFast(false)); err != nil {
    270 		return err
    271 	}
    272 	return nil
    273 }
